page.title: 20GREEN BELT:UPMINSTER
page.content: In 1938 the Green Belt Act was passed to limit London's sprawl. Only{rurally {appropriate developments}are allowed; farm buildings, sports pavillions, & others to increase the enjoyment of the countryside. A varied area with rural & urban uses produced scenery from attractive to gravel pits & tips. The whole of this block is affected by Green Belt restrictions.{60% is {agricultural,about 15% urban,& large {areas are devoted to gravel quarrying {which are later reclaimed by tipping & {landscaping.}Despite the general necessity for intensive landuse around the edge of a city there still remain {nature reserves & woodlands:even rough {grazing.} Building has not been halted entirely as{3 new schools,a crematorium, lakes {for sailing}& biggest impact of all, {the M25,}occupy about{10%}of the area.
